parameter.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
parameter.description: Wait time between size checks to determine if a file is ready to be read. This allows a file write to complete before processing. If no value is provided, the check will not be performed. When enabled, Mule performs two size checks waiting the specified time between calls. If both checks return the same value, the file is ready to be read.This attribute works in tandem with #timeBetweenSizeCheckUnit.

parameter.name: timeBetweenSizeCheckUnit
parameter.description:
A TimeUnit which qualifies the #timeBetweenSizeCheck attribute.

Defaults to MILLISECONDS

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

connection.name: connection
connection.description: An FileSystemProvider which provides instances of SftpFileSystem from instances of SftpConnector

parameter.name: workingDir
parameter.description: The directory to be considered as the root of every relative path used with this connector. If not provided, it will default to the remote server default.

parameter.name: preferredAuthenticationMethods
parameter.description: Set of authentication methods used by the SFTP client. Valid values are: GSSAPI_WITH_MIC, PUBLIC_KEY, KEYBOARD_INTERACTIVE and PASSWORD.

parameter.name: knownHostsFile
parameter.description: If provided, the client will validate the server's key against the one in the referenced file. If the server key doesn't match the one in the file, the connection will be aborted.

parameter.name: sftp-proxy-config
parameter.description: If provided, a proxy will be used for the connection.

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description:
A scalar value representing the amount of time to wait before a connection attempt times out. This attribute works in tandem with #connectionTimeoutUnit.

Defaults to 10

parameter.name: connectionTimeoutUnit
parameter.description:
A TimeUnit which qualifies the #connectionTimeout attribute.

Defaults to SECONDS

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description:
A scalar value representing the amount of time to wait before a request for data times out. This attribute works in tandem with #responseTimeoutUnit.

Defaults to 10

parameter.name: responseTimeoutUnit
parameter.description:
A TimeUnit which qualifies the #responseTimeoutUnit attribute.

Defaults to SECONDS

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: The FTP server host, such as www.mulesoft.com, localhost, or 192.168.0.1, etc

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port number of the SFTP server to connect on

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: Username for the FTP Server. Required if the server is authenticated.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password for the FTP Server. Required if the server is authenticated.

parameter.name: passphrase
parameter.description: The passphrase (password) for the identityFile if required. Notice that this parameter is ignored if #identityFile is not provided

parameter.name: identityFile
parameter.description: An identityFile location for a PKI private key.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: poolingProfile
parameter.description: Characteristics of the connection pool

connection.name: connection
connection.description: An FileSystemProvider which provides instances of SftpFileSystem from instances of SftpConnector

parameter.name: workingDir
parameter.description: The directory to be considered as the root of every relative path used with this connector. If not provided, it will default to the remote server default.

parameter.name: preferredAuthenticationMethods
parameter.description: Set of authentication methods used by the SFTP client. Valid values are: GSSAPI_WITH_MIC, PUBLIC_KEY, KEYBOARD_INTERACTIVE and PASSWORD.

parameter.name: knownHostsFile
parameter.description: If provided, the client will validate the server's key against the one in the referenced file. If the server key doesn't match the one in the file, the connection will be aborted.

parameter.name: sftp-proxy-config
parameter.description: If provided, a proxy will be used for the connection.

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description:
A scalar value representing the amount of time to wait before a connection attempt times out. This attribute works in tandem with #connectionTimeoutUnit.

Defaults to 10

parameter.name: connectionTimeoutUnit
parameter.description:
A TimeUnit which qualifies the #connectionTimeout attribute.

Defaults to SECONDS

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description:
A scalar value representing the amount of time to wait before a request for data times out. This attribute works in tandem with #responseTimeoutUnit.

Defaults to 10

parameter.name: responseTimeoutUnit
parameter.description:
A TimeUnit which qualifies the #responseTimeoutUnit attribute.

Defaults to SECONDS

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: The FTP server host, such as www.mulesoft.com, localhost, or 192.168.0.1, etc

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port number of the SFTP server to connect on

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: Username for the FTP Server. Required if the server is authenticated.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password for the FTP Server. Required if the server is authenticated.

parameter.name: passphrase
parameter.description: The passphrase (password) for the identityFile if required. Notice that this parameter is ignored if #identityFile is not provided

parameter.name: identityFile
parameter.description: An identityFile location for a PKI private key.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: poolingProfile
parameter.description: Characteristics of the connection pool

extension.name: SFTP
extension.description: Allows manipulating files through the FTP and SFTP

operation.name: copy
operation.description:
Copies the file at the sourcePath into the targetPath.

If targetPath doesn't exist, and neither does its parent, then an attempt will be made to create depending on the value of the createParentFolder argument. If such argument is , then a SFTP:ILLEGAL_PATH will be thrown.

If the target file already exists, then it will be overwritten if the overwrite argument is true. Otherwise, SFTP:FILE_ALREADY_EXISTS error will be thrown.

As for the sourcePath, it can either be a file or a directory. If it points to a directory, then it will be copied recursively.

parameter.name: sourcePath
parameter.description: the path to the file to be copied

parameter.name: targetPath
parameter.description: the target directory where the file is going to be copied

parameter.name: createParentDirectories
parameter.description: whether or not to attempt creating any parent directories which don't exists.

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.description: whether or not overwrite the file if the target destination already exists.

parameter.name: renameTo
parameter.description: copied file's new name. If not provided, original file name will be kept.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: createDirectory
operation.description: Creates a new directory on directoryPath

parameter.name: directoryPath
parameter.description: the new directory's name

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: delete
operation.description: Deletes the file pointed by path, provided that it's not locked

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: the path to the file to be deleted

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: list
operation.description:
Lists all the files in the directoryPath which match the given matcher.

If the listing encounters a directory, the output list will include its contents depending on the value of the recursive parameter.

If recursive is set to true but a found directory is rejected by the matcher, then there won't be any recursion into such directory.

parameter.name: directoryPath
parameter.description: the path to the directory to be listed

parameter.name: recursive
parameter.description: whether to include the contents of sub-directories. Defaults to false.

parameter.name: matcher
parameter.description: a matcher used to filter the output list

parameter.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
parameter.description: wait time between size checks to determine if a file is ready to be read.

parameter.name: timeBetweenSizeCheckUnit
parameter.description: time unit to be used in the wait time between size checks.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: move
operation.description:
Moves the file at the sourcePath into the targetPath.

If targetPath doesn't exist, and neither does its parent, then an attempt will be made to create depending on the value of the createParentFolder argument. If such argument is , then a SFTP:ILLEGAL_PATH will be thrown.

If the target file already exists, then it will be overwritten if the overwrite argument is true. Otherwise, SFTP:FILE_ALREADY_EXISTS error will be thrown.

As for the sourcePath, it can either be a file or a directory. If it points to a directory, then it will be moved recursively.

parameter.name: sourcePath
parameter.description: the path to the file to be copied

parameter.name: targetPath
parameter.description: the target directory

parameter.name: createParentDirectories
parameter.description: whether or not to attempt creating any parent directories which don't exists.

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.description: whether or not overwrite the file if the target destination already exists.

parameter.name: renameTo
parameter.description: moved file's new name. If not provided, original file name will be kept.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: read
operation.description:
Obtains the content and metadata of a file at a given path. The operation itself returns a Message which payload is a InputStream with the file's content, and the metadata is represent as a SftpFileAttributes object that's placed as the message Message#getAttributes() attributes.

If the lock parameter is set to true, then a file system level lock will be placed on the file until the input stream this operation returns is closed or fully consumed. Because the lock is actually provided by the host file system, its behavior might change depending on the mounted drive and the operation system on which mule is running. Take that into consideration before blindly relying on this lock.

This method also makes a best effort to determine the mime type of the file being read. The file's extension will be used to make an educated guess on the file's mime type. The user also has the chance to force the output encoding and mimeType through the outputEncoding and outputMimeType optional parameters.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: the path to the file to be read

parameter.name: lock
parameter.description: whether or not to lock the file. Defaults to false.

parameter.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
parameter.description: wait time between size checks to determine if a file is ready to be read.

parameter.name: timeBetweenSizeCheckUnit
parameter.description: time unit to be used in the wait time between size checks.

parameter.name: outputMimeType
parameter.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.

parameter.name: outputEncoding
parameter.description: The encoding of the payload that this operation outputs.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: rename
operation.description:
Renames the file pointed by path to the name provided on the to parameter

to argument should not contain any path separator. SFTP:ILLEGAL_PATH will be thrown if this precondition is not honored.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: the path to the file to be renamed

parameter.name: to
parameter.description: the file's new name

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.description: whether or not overwrite the file if the target destination already exists.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: write
operation.description:
Writes the content into the file pointed by path.

If the directory on which the file is attempting to be written doesn't exist, then the operation will either throw SFTP:ILLEGAL_PATH error or create such folder depending on the value of the createParentDirectory.

If the file itself already exists, then the behavior depends on the supplied mode.

This operation also supports locking support depending on the value of the lock argument, but following the same rules and considerations as described in the read operation.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: the path of the file to be written

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: the content to be written into the file. Defaults to the current Message payload

parameter.name: createParentDirectories
parameter.description: whether or not to attempt creating any parent directories which don't exists.

parameter.name: lock
parameter.description: whether or not to lock the file. Defaults to false

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description: a FileWriteMode. Defaults to OVERWRITE

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

source.name: listener
source.description:
Polls a directory looking for files that have been created on it. One message will be generated for each file that is found.

The key part of this functionality is how to determine that a file is actually new. There're three strategies for that:

  • Set the autoDelete parameter to true: This will delete each processed file after it has been processed, causing all files obtained in the next poll to be necessarily new
  • Set moveToDirectory parameter: This will move each processed file to a different directory after it has been processed, achieving the same effect as autoDelete but without loosing the file
  • Use the watermarkMode parameter to only pick files that have been created/updated after the last poll was executed.

A matcher can also be used for additional filtering of files.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.description: The directory on which polled files are contained

parameter.name: recursive
parameter.description: Whether or not to also files contained in sub directories.

parameter.name: matcher
parameter.description: A matcher used to filter events on files which do not meet the matcher's criteria

parameter.name: watermarkEnabled
parameter.description: Controls whether or not to do watermarking, and if so, if the watermark should consider the file's modification or creation timestamps

parameter.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
parameter.description: Wait time in milliseconds between size checks to determine if a file is ready to be read. This allows a file write to complete before processing. You can disable this feature by omitting a value. When enabled, Mule performs two size checks waiting the specified time between calls. If both checks return the same value, the file is ready to be read.

parameter.name: timeBetweenSizeCheckUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #timeBetweenSizeCheck attribute.

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: schedulingStrategy
parameter.description: Configures the scheduler that triggers the polling

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: autoDelete
parameter.description: Whether each file should be deleted after processing or not

parameter.name: moveToDirectory
parameter.description: If provided, each processed file will be moved to a directory pointed by this path.

parameter.name: renameTo
parameter.description: This parameter works in tandem with moveToDirectory. Use this parameter to enter the name under which the file should be moved. Do not set this parameter if moveToDirectory hasn't been set as well.

parameter.name: applyPostActionWhenFailed
parameter.description: Whether any of the post actions (autoDelete and moveToDirectory) should also be applied in case the file failed to be processed. If set to false, no failed files will be moved nor deleted.

type.name: org.mule.extension.sftp.api.SftpFileAttributes
type.description:
Metadata about a file in a SFTP server
@since 1.0

type.name: org.mule.extension.sftp.api.SftpFileMatcher

parameter.name: timestampSince
parameter.description: Files created before this date are rejected.

parameter.name: timestampUntil
parameter.description: Files created after this date are rejected.

parameter.name: notUpdatedInTheLast
parameter.description: Minimum time that should have passed since a file was updated to not be rejected. This attribute works in tandem with #timeUnit.

parameter.name: updatedInTheLast
parameter.description: Maximum time that should have passed since a file was updated to not be rejected. This attribute works in tandem with #timeUnit.

parameter.name: timeUnit
parameter.description:
A #notUpdatedInTheLast attributes.

Defaults to MILLISECONDS

type.name: org.mule.extension.sftp.api.SftpProxyConfig
type.description:
A Proxy configuration for the SFTP connector.
@since 3.9
